title: Language Matters Speaker Series on Translanguaging
description: Join us for the first webinar this semester on language pedagogy on Monday, Feb. 24, at 5pm via Zoom."Beyond Boundaries: Pedagogical Translanguaging and the Transformation of Language Learning" by Dr. Mihi Park, NUS SingaporeMany language classrooms have become vibrant spaces of linguistic diversity, presenting opportunities and challenges to traditional language instruction. Recognising this potential, language instructors are reimagining course design through the lens of pedagogical translanguaging. In this webinar, I will share a compelling narrative of how translanguaging can create meaningful bridges between existing and new knowledge. This approach encourages students to view language not as a rigid system, but as a fluid, interconnected resource.Register at https://bit.ly/nyuad-lmss

title: CGSB XIII Symposium February 19-21, 2025
description: The Center for Genomics and Systems Biology, in collaboration with NYUAD Institute, will host the thirteenth annual Genomics and Systems Biology Symposium on February 19-21, 2025.Discover how AI and machine learning tools transform the ability to analyze large datasets, uncovering hidden patterns in basic and clinical research. title: Want to participate in brain research?
description: ASPIRE Precision Medicine Research Institute Abu Dhabi invites you to participate in a MRI study here at NYUAD! The institute’s mission is to gain a better understanding of conditions prevalent in the region.For the first session, we will first collect demographic data and vision tests. Then, we will collect a series of brain scans in the MRI scanner. Finally, we will collect a saliva sample. The study will take approximately 2 hours to complete. The second session will consist of a 1 hour OCT scan and virtual reality vision tests. You will be compensated with vouchers worth 180 AED.You are eligible to participate if you are above 18 years of age, do not have a history of neurological conditions, are not pregnant at the time of the study, and do not have non-removable metal.If you are interested please email the researchers below with the subject line “MRI study.”Last names A-M contact Aysha Hamkari:aah698@nyu.eduLast names N-Z contact Dana Alkalali:dna8993@nyu.edu
